text: <@U02M9GZTEGH> I don't know if you solved this, but what I do is that when an access token fails, I try get a new one with a refresh token, if that fails, then I send a call to the billing system to pause their account. For your situation, you only need to differentiate between the users and all webhook calls that HubSpot sends to your app include the appId, the portalId, and the user of the person making the action. It might need to redoing your DB a little, but you can divide it by person

G'day Folks,

My app just launched on the HubSpot App Marketplace - Journey Manager Pro.
It allows companies to organise and report on activity across owned media sources across a company and also report based on company profile and lifecycle stage.
You can see what types of content are more engaged with earlier on by certain companies and which later.

Get actual organised user behaviour of your media that can be translated into actions for the next marketing strategy.
Think of it as what happens if you have take salesforce's campaign history, put in into HubSpot and make it 100x more scalable and usable
<https://app.HubSpot.com/portal-recommend/l?slug=ecosystem/marketplace/apps/marketing/analytics-data/campaign-activity-manager-1088053>
Nice work Yiz! I really like using the app
